intro: Lantana brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian lantana, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red, which bloom throughout the year in many regions. Its flowers are typically followed by small, round berries that contain seeds. Lantana brasiliensis is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun to partial shade.
